meanings.definition: The quality of being suitable or capable of being worked on or completed.
meanings.sent1: The workableness of the project made it easy to finish on time.
meanings.sent2: The workableness of the material allowed for smooth construction.
meanings.sent3: The workableness of the puzzle made it a breeze to solve.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity added a new level of workableness to the team's ideas.
meanings.sent5: The workableness of the plan was evident in its flawless execution.

meanings.definition: The ability to be effective or practical in achieving a desired outcome.
meanings.sent1: The workableness of the strategy ensured success in the project.
meanings.sent2: His workableness in problem-solving impressed his colleagues.
meanings.sent3: The workableness of the invention amazed everyone with its simplicity.
meanings.sent4: The workableness of her advice led to positive changes in the company.
meanings.sent5: The workableness of the solution was evident in its immediate impact.
